If you drive south on HWY 75 towards Atlanta, about an hour and a half south, there is the Confederate Railroad museum. They have the General there. Off of Hwy 75 North, towards Oolteway, which is where I live, there is a bookstore called McKay's, right next to it is a Harley Davidson dealership and beside that is a Confederate graveyard which is very interesting. If you decide to make the trip all the way down to Atlanta, you can see Stone Mountain, the worlds largest Batholith and it has the Confederate sculpture on the face, similar to Mt. Rushmore. There is also the Cyclorama there which has a panorama painting of the war, 360 degrees around. The Atlanta aquarium puts all the others to shame, they have a whale shark in theirs! Down on Market St in Chattanooga, they have the Imax theater next to the aquarium as well.
